case_vignette: A 55-year-old man with a history of myocardial infarction 3 months ago presents with feelings of depression. He says that he has become detached from his friends and family and has daily feelings of hopelessness. He says he has started to avoid strenuous activities and is no longer going to his favorite bar where he used to spend a lot of time drinking with his buddies. The patient says these symptoms have been ongoing for the past 6 weeks, and his wife is starting to worry about his behavior. He notes that he continues to have nightmares that he is having another heart attack. He says he is even more jumpy than he used to be, and he startles very easily.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling depressed, detached from friends and family, hopeless, and I'm avoiding strenuous activities and places where I used to hang out, like my favorite bar.
How long have you been feeling this way?
These symptoms have been ongoing for the past 6 weeks.
Have you experienced any changes in your sleep patterns, appetite, or weight recently?
I have been having nightmares that I'm having another heart attack.
Have you had a heart attack or any other heart-related issues in the past? If yes, when did it happen?
Yes, I had a heart attack 3 months ago.
Are you currently on any medication for your heart or any other condition?
I don't know, you didn't ask me that.
What medications are you currently taking following your heart attack?
I'm sorry, but I can't provide any information about medications since it isn't mentioned in the case vignette.
Understood. Do you have a history of depression or any other mental health condition either personally or in your family?
The vignette doesn't mention any history of depression or other mental health conditions in my personal or family history.
Final Diagnosis: Adjustment disorder with depressed mood, due to the recent heart attack and associated lifestyle changes.
